Predict Pairwise Compositional Turnover (ζ-dissimilarity)

Source: R/predict_dissim.R
predict_dissim.Rd

Generates spatial predictions of order-2 compositional turnover (\(\zeta_2\)) from a fitted zetadiv multi-site generalised dissimilarity model (Zeta.msgdm). See calculate_pairwise_distances_matrix() for the distance routine that this function calls internally.

Usage

predict_dissim(
  block_sp,
  sbe_scaled,
  zeta_model,
  mean_rich,
  mean_turn,
  sbs_xy,
  rsa = NULL,
  x_col = "x",
  y_col = "y"
)

Arguments

block_sp

Data frame of site metadata; must contain a unique grid_id column and coordinate columns given by x_col, y_col.

sbe_scaled

Data frame or matrix of scaled environmental predictors (row order identical to block_sp).

zeta_model

A fitted model returned by zetadiv::Zeta.msgdm().

mean_rich

Data frame with columns order and value giving the mean species richness (order = 1) for annotation.

mean_turn

Data frame with columns order and value giving the mean turnover (order = 2) for annotation.

sbs_xy

Data frame with site coordinates in the same order as sbe_scaled; must contain x_col, y_col.

rsa

Optional sf or SpatVector polygon to draw on the figure.

x_col, y_col

Names of the longitude / latitude columns (defaults "x", "y").

Value

A data frame containing all predictors plus:

distance

Mean great-circle distance (km) to all other sites.

rich_o1

Mean richness (order 1) from mean_rich.

turn_o2

Mean turnover (order 2) from mean_turn.

pred_zeta

Linear predictor on the logit scale.

pred_zetaExp

Predicted turnover on the 0–1 scale.

log_pred_zetaExp

Natural-log of pred_zetaExp.

A ggplot2 heat-map is printed for visual inspection.

See also

calculate_pairwise_distances_matrix

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
##----------------------------------------------------------
## Toy example with 15 sites, two predictors, 60 species
##----------------------------------------------------------
library(zetadiv)
set.seed(123)

n_sites <- 15
block_sp <- data.frame(
  grid_id = sprintf("g%02d", 1:n_sites),
  x       = runif(n_sites, 22, 24),
  y       = runif(n_sites, -34, -33)
)

env_raw <- data.frame(
  temp = rnorm(n_sites, 20, 2),
  rain = rnorm(n_sites, 600, 40)
)
sbe_scaled <- scale(env_raw) |> as.data.frame()

## Simulate a simple community matrix
comm <- matrix(rbinom(n_sites * 60, 1, 0.15),
               nrow = n_sites,
               dimnames = list(block_sp$grid_id, paste0("sp", 1:60)))

## Fit a Zeta.msgdm model (quick settings for example)
z_mod <- zetadiv::Zeta.msgdm(
  data.spec = comm,
  data.env  = env_raw,
  xy        = block_sp[, c("x", "y")],
  order     = 2,
  sam       = 100
)

mean_rich <- data.frame(order = 1, value = mean(rowSums(comm)))
mean_turn <- data.frame(order = 2, value = mean(z_mod$zeta.val))

res <- predict_dissim(
  block_sp   = block_sp,
  sbe_scaled = sbe_scaled,
  zeta_model = z_mod,
  mean_rich  = mean_rich,
  mean_turn  = mean_turn,
  sbs_xy     = block_sp
)

head(res)
} # }
